items.title: Protein engineering fixes a major crop trade-off
items.one_liner: Nature, Published online: 25 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00293-6 Rational design of a regulatory protein decouples the ability to tolerate cold from the means to acquire phosphorus, effectively enhancing crop yield under cold stress.

items.title: BEST: Basic Embedding Search Tool Enhancing Discovery of Novel Enzyme.

items.one_liner: The identification of protein homologs in large databases is critical for biological advancements. Traditional methods, such as protein sequence alignment, often miss remote homologs. items.title: Geometric deep learning assists protein engineering. Opportunities and Challenges.

items.one_liner: Enzyme engineering involves enhancing enzyme function and application through multidimensional technological systems. Its development encompasses elucidating sequence-structure-function relationships, exploring fitness landscapes, and multiscale regulation. items.title: A survey of downstream applications of evolutionary scale modeling protein language models.

items.title: The Man Who Stole Infinity
items.one_liner: In an 1874 paper, Georg Cantor proved that there are different sizes of infinity and changed math forever. A trove of newly unearthed letters shows that it was also an act of plagiarism. The post The Man Who Stole Infinity first appeared on
